intro: Allamanda oenotherifolia, commonly known as the yellow allamanda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has heart-shaped, glossy leaves and produces orange or yellow berries that contain toxic seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance. However, it is important to note that all parts of the plant are poisonous and should be handled with care.
